title: Yeats - The Man and the Echo (2015) BBC ABEE
description:
Yeats - The Man and the Echo (2015) BBC ABEE
 <a href="
http://ichef.bbci.co.uk/images/ic/640x360/p02tk25p.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://ichef.bbci.co.uk/images/ic/640x360/p02tk25p.jpg</a>

Yeats - The Man and the Echo
BBC Radio 4
21 June - 5 July 2015

Three Irish writers choose three Yeats poems as inspiration for a story.

Episode 1 - Sailing to Byzantium (21 June 2015)
Niall Williams' enchanting story inspired by WB Yeats' poem about mortality and immortality.

An old man walks through a dusty and hot antiques shop where he finds something remarkable and life changing.

Writer ..... Niall Williams
Reader ..... Dermot Crowley
Producer ..... Kirsty Williams

A BBC Scotland Production for BBC Radio 4.

Episode 2 - An Irish Airman Foresees His Death (28 June 2015)
Lynda Radley's poignant story inspired by WB Yeats' sonnet about a World War I fighter-pilot.

An Irish airline pilot with a gambling problem reflects on his life.
Writer    Lynda Radley
Reader    Eugene O'Hare
Producer    Kirsty Williams

Episode 3 - What Then? (5 July 2015)
Dermot Bolger's reflective story inspired by WB Yeats' poem about the endless doubts writers face.

A young man timidly embarking on a life as a writer meets an old man with a story to tell. 

Writer    Dermot Bolger
Reader    Paul Hickey
Producer    Kirsty Williams
